Package Framework

Class Player.Builder

java.lang.Object
Framework.Player.Builder
Enclosing class:
Player
public static class Player.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
Inner class to create a Player object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Builder​(java.lang.String name)
    Builder is used instead of a regular constructor

    Example usage:
    Player player = new Player.Builder(String name).build();

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Player.Builder addAttribute​(java.lang.String name, int value)
    Adds an attribute variable to a Player
    Player.Builder addInput​(java.lang.String up, java.lang.String down, java.lang.String left, java.lang.String right)
    Adds specific input buttons to Player
    Player.Builder addLevel​(int level)
    Adds a level variable to a Player
    Player.Builder addMovementSpeed​(int movementSpeed)
    Adds a specific movementSpeed to a Player Has a default value of 5 if not set
    Player.Builder addMovementSpeedMultiplier​(double movementSpeedMultiplier)
    Adds a movement speed multiplier to a Player Used to add either walking or running
    Player.Builder addPosition​(int posX, int posY)
    Adds a specific start position to the Player object Has a default value of 100x100 if not set
    Player.Builder addSize​(int width, int height)
    Adds a specific size to a Player Has a default value of 50x50 if not set
    Player.Builder addSprite​(Sprite sprite)
    Adds a specific sprite to a Player Sprite is set to a square by default
    Player.Builder addXp​(int xp)
    Adds a xp variable to a Player
    Player build()
    Creates a Player object

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Builder

      public Builder​(java.lang.String name)
      Builder is used instead of a regular constructor

      Example usage:
      Player player = new Player.Builder(String name).build();

  • Method Details

    • addSize

      public Player.Builder addSize​(int width, int height)
      Adds a specific size to a Player Has a default value of 50x50 if not set
      Parameters:
      width - Sets the width variable
      height - Sets the height variable

      Example usage:
      Player player = new Player.Builder(String name).addSize(int width, int height).build();

    • addPosition

      public Player.Builder addPosition​(int posX, int posY)
      Adds a specific start position to the Player object Has a default value of 100x100 if not set
      Parameters:
      posX - Sets the X variable
      posY - Sets the Y variable

      Example usage:
      Player player = new Player.Builder(String name).addPosition(int posX, int posY).build();

    • addMovementSpeed

      public Player.Builder addMovementSpeed​(int movementSpeed)
      Adds a specific movementSpeed to a Player Has a default value of 5 if not set
      Parameters:
      movementSpeed - Sets the movementSpeed variable

      Example usage:
      Player player = new Player.Builder(String name).addMovementSpeed(int movementSpeed).build();

    • addMovementSpeedMultiplier

      public Player.Builder addMovementSpeedMultiplier​(double movementSpeedMultiplier)
      Adds a movement speed multiplier to a Player Used to add either walking or running
      Parameters:
      movementSpeedMultiplier - Sets the movementSpeedMultiplier variable

      Example usage:
      Player player = new Player.Builder(String name).addMovementSpeedMultiplier(double movementSpeedMultiplier).build();

    • addSprite

      public Player.Builder addSprite​(Sprite sprite)
      Adds a specific sprite to a Player Sprite is set to a square by default
      Parameters:
      sprite - Takes a Sprite object and adds it to a Player

      Example usage:
      Player player = new Player.Builder(String name).addSprite(Sprite sprite).build();

    • addInput

      public Player.Builder addInput​(java.lang.String up, java.lang.String down, java.lang.String left, java.lang.String right)
      Adds specific input buttons to Player
      Parameters:
      up - Takes a String KeyEvent.VK_keycode
      down - Takes a String KeyEvent.VK_keycode
      left - Takes a String KeyEvent.VK_keycode
      right - Takes a String KeyEvent.VK_keycode

      Example usage:
      Player player = new Player.Builder(String name).addInput("W","A","S","D").build();

    • addLevel

      public Player.Builder addLevel​(int level)
      Adds a level variable to a Player
      Parameters:
      level - Sets the level variable

      Usage:
      Player player = new Player.Builder(String name).addLevel(int level).build();

    • addXp

      public Player.Builder addXp​(int xp)
      Adds a xp variable to a Player
      Parameters:
      xp - Sets the xp variable

      Usage:
      Player player = new Player.Builder(String name).addXp(int xp).build();

    • addAttribute

      public Player.Builder addAttribute​(java.lang.String name, int value)
      Adds an attribute variable to a Player
      Parameters:
      name - Sets the attribute name
      value - sets the attribute value

      Example usage:
      Player player = new Player.Builder(String name).addAttribute(String name, int value).build();

    • build

      public Player build()
      Creates a Player object
      Returns:
      Returns a Player object with the given values
